intro: Acinodendron obovatum, commonly known as the broad-ovate acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite, obovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, and its fruit is a capsule that releases seeds when mature. This species is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
